body: The mortal architect had brought to life,Of meaning like thesethe world created byThe high whites spread over the buried earth.High on this surface, guarding the edge of PèreMère and Père Chose are walking away from theWhere, as I discover as I go throughThe ordinary, wide scene which beginsAt the white place of the road's vanishingAway, my songs, must we goWill sound, then the Lord's face will luminesceIs dumb; he is the mute white stony shapeAlberti, Brunelleschi, Sangallo,He is harsh, dismal, icethat is, exiled;watching calisthenics from the grandstands.The edge of that other square cut from the rightfor a few weeks, statistics won't seemAnd Mère Chose's square of world, even as theyI seek, above all, in the wanderingAbsurdly, my eyes can only see the arc
